page.title: 03MR RITCH'S FARM
page.content: Mr Ritch is a local farmer who owns 174 acres. He enjoys farming although it does not have regular hours. When it's silage time they often work late into the night to collect 600 tons of silage for animal feeding.The vet comes to the farm to look at the animals about six times a year.Mr Ritch employs two workers who help him to work with 108 animals.There were 63 calves born last year.Sometimes Mr Ritch gets hardly any sleep at night because of cows calving.His cows produce around 200 gallons of milk a week.A dairy farm has an early start in the morning as the milk tanker comes about nine to take the milk to Kirkwall. His hens lay about 80-100 eggs a day. He thinks farming is an enjoyable and reasonably profitable business.
